raw_text:
Robben and Cole earn Chelsea win
 
 Cheslea salvaged a win against a battling Portsmouth side just as it looked like the Premiership leaders would have to settle for a point.
 
 Arjen Robben curled in a late deflected left-footed shot from the right side of Pompey's box to break the home side's brave resistance. Chelsea had been continually frustrated but Joe Cole added a second with a 20-yard shot in injury-time. Nigel Quashie had Pompey's best chance when his effort was tipped over. The Fratton Park crowd were in good voice as usual and, even though Portsmouth more than held their own, Chelsea still managed to carve out two early chances. Striker Didier Drogba snapped in an angled shot to force home keeper Shaka Hislop into a smart save while an unmarked Frank Lampard had a strike blocked by Arjan De Zeeuw. But Pompey chased, harried and unsettled a Chelsea side as the south-coast side started to gain the upper hand and almost took the lead through Quashie.
 
 The midfielder struck a swerving long range shot which keeper Petr Cech tipped over at full stretch. Pompey stretched Arsenal to the limit recently and were providing a similarly tough obstacle to overcome for a Chelsea team struggling to exert any pressure. Velimir Zajec's players stood firm as the visitors came out in lively fashion after the break but, just as they took a stranglehold of the match, the visitors launched a counter-attack. Drogba spun to get a sight of goal and struck a fierce shot which rocked keeper Hislop back as he blocked before Arjan de Zeeuw cleared the danger.
 
 The home side were also left breathing a sigh of relief when a Glen Johnson header fell to Gudjohnsen who had his back to goal in a crowded Pompey goalmouth. The Icelandic forward tried to acrobatically direct the ball into goal but put his effort over. But, just like against Arsenal, Portsmouth let in a late goal when Robben's shot took a deflection off Matthew Taylor on its way past a wrong-footed Hislop. And Cole put a bit of gloss on a hard-fought win when he put a low shot into the bottom of the Pompey net.
 
 Hislop, Griffin, Primus, De Zeeuw, Taylor, Stone (Cisse 76), Quashie (Berkovic 83), Faye, O'Neil, Kamara (Fuller 65), Yakubu.
 
 Subs Not Used: Berger, Ashdown.
 
 Kamara.
 
 Cech, Paulo Ferreira, Gallas, Terry, Johnson, Duff, Makelele, Smertin (Cole 73), Lampard, Robben (Geremi 81), Drogba (Gudjohnsen 58).
 
 Subs Not Used: Cudicini, Bridge.
 
 Paulo Ferreira, Robben, Lampard.
 
 Robben 79, Cole 90.
 
 20,210
 
 A Wiley (Staffordshire).
llama3.2:1b: Chelsea scored two goals in a 2-1 win over Portsmouth at Stamford Bridge. Arjen Robben curled in the winning goal in injury time. Joe Cole also scored in the 90th minute. The match was decided after Pompey's Nigel Quashie had his best chance denied by goalkeeper Shaka Hislop, but ultimately fell to Chelsea.
llama3.2:3b: Chelsea salvaged a win against Portsmouth with Arjen Robben's late deflected shot and Joe Cole's injury-time goal, as the visitors continually frustrated but ultimately broke down Pompey's resistance.
gemma2:2b: Chelsea won against Portsmouth in a hard-fought match. Arjen Robben scored the winning goal with a deflected shot late in the game. Joe Cole added a second goal in injury time.  The match was close until Chelsea's counterattack, which led to their final win.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Chelsea won against Portsmouth by a point. The home team scored late goals from Arjen Robben and Joe Cole with Liverpool not giving up. Pompey made a strong effort to take the lead but Chelsea's players were able to score. Pompey tried to come back but failed to win the match.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea won 2-1 against Portsmouth in a Premiership match. Arjen Robben scored the winner with a late free-kick, and Joe Cole added an insurance goal in stoppage time. The match was tense with Pompey frequently threatening but struggling to break through Chelsea's defense.
qwen2.5:3b: Chelsea secured a win against battling Portsmouth despite initial frustration. Arjen Robben scored the winning goal with a deflected shot from distance in injury time. Joe Cole added another goal to seal the victory for Chelsea. Portsmouth had several chances but were held back by robust defending. The match was closely contested, with both teams displaying strong resistance and moments of brilliance. Substitute players also contributed significantly, especially Arjen Robben and Joe Cole.
opencoder:1.5b: Robben and Cole earn the Chelsea win with a 90-yard shot. Arjen Robben curls in a late goal shot from the right side of Pompey's box. The home team struggles to carve out two early chances but they do it. The midfielder hits a swerving long range shot which keeper Petr Cech tips over at full stretch. The south-coast team almost took the lead through Quashie. Striker Didier Drogba snatches in an angled shot while an unmarked Frank Lampard had a strike blocked by Arjan De Zeeuw. But, they chased, harried and unsettled a Chelsea team as the match continued to gain pressure. The home side were also left breathing a sigh of relief when a Glen Johnson header fell to Gudjohnsen who had his back to goal in a crowded Pompey net. The Icelandic forward tried to acrobatically direct the ball into goal but put his effort over. The visitors launched a counter-attack on a short period of time, but they quickly reposed and won the game.
smollm:1.7b: Robben and Cole earn Chelsea win

Chelsea earned a win over Pompey in their Premier League match, with Arjen Robben securing a late winner from Pompey's box and Joe Cole adding a second goal in injury-time. The home side responded with two early goals, including a goalkeeper saving Frank Lampard's cross. Despite their efforts, Portsmouth pulled off a hard-fought victory after a late counter-attack by Drogba. Chelsea's key players included Didier Drogba, Faye, and Niko Quashie. Notable scorers for both teams were Drogba and Faye, while the starting lineup featured several top talent.
tinyllama:1.1b: The following text provides a brief summary of the match between Arsenal and Portsmouth in the Premier League on August 2nd, 2004. The game ended as a 2-1 victory for Arsenal, with the goals coming from Robben and Cole, who scored at both halves to secure the win. The game took place at Fratton Park, and the attendance was 20,210.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
After reviewing the text carefully, I have determined that it is providing information about a football match between Chelsea and Portsmouth which resulted in a 2-1 win for Chelsea. The game took place at Stamford Bridge on September 7th, 2012, and involved teams from the English Premier League. 

Some key points in the summary include:

1) Chelsea won against Portsmouth 2-1.
2) Arjen Robben scored the winning goal for Chelsea with a left-footed shot.
3) Joe Cole added a second goal for Chelsea with a right-footed shot in injury time.
4) Nigel Quashie scored for Portsmouth, taking the lead but eventually losing it through an own goal by Frank Lampard.
5) The game saw multiple substitutions by both teams.
6) The match was played on a rainy day with Pompey's best chance of winning being when Arjen Robben curled in a left-footed shot that almost broke Chelsea's defense, but it was tipped over by Shaka Hislop.
7) Portsmouth tried to create a counterattack and eventually won the ball back after the break, but Chelsea kept them at bay until the 90th minute when Arjen Robben scored the winning goal.
8) Petr Cech saved a penalty taken by Velimir Zajec in the closing stages of extra time.
9) Portsmouth's midfielder Velimir Zajec was sent off for a bookable challenge on Frank Lampard.
10) The crowd at Stamford Bridge booed Chelsea supporters and called for their team to win.
phi:2.7b: Chelsea beat Portsmouth 3-1 in the Premier League game at Fratton Park. Arjen Robben scored a late goal from the right side of Pompey's box and Joe Cole added another in injury time. However, Pompey nearly equalized through Didier Drogba's angled shot which was saved by Shaka Hislop. The match was tight throughout with both teams creating chances, but Chelsea held on to win thanks to their strong defense and a brilliant performance from their midfielders.
